newsitem.title: JAPAN: Konami, IBM Japan jointly develop 3D graphics.
newsitem.headline: Konami, IBM Japan jointly develop 3D graphics.

text.p: Konami Co Ltd and IBM Japan Ltd, a unit of IBM Corp, have jointly developed next generation three-dimensional (3D) graphics technology, Konami said on Wednesday.
The new technology has the maximum capacity of five million polygons per second, allowing more vivid three-dimensional images in games, the company said in a statement.
A Konami spokesman said games that are in the market at present have a capacity of only 330,000 polygons per second at most.

The company is currently developing video games using its new technology in Cobra, a three-dimensional martial arts game platform, which will be displayed at the 34th Amusement Machine Show in Japan in mid-September, it said.
The spokesman said the company expects to launch the game next spring.
